intro: Boopis ameghinoi, commonly known as the "Cordillera de Los Andes" plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Boopis ameghinoi is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
